Yelp.description: They did a great job installing my fence. The price felt reasonable. They walk you through every step of the way and are incredibly clear with their communication. They are also very fast in the installing of the fence. Can't recommend them highly enough!

Yelp.title: They did a great job installing my fence.

Google.description: We had a great experience with using Ergeon for our backyard fence installation. From the point of my initial request and all the way to the installation they were right on dot. They were very responsive to my inquiries, provided all details up front and keep me updated about the installation steps. The installers knew what they were doing. Overall I am a very happy customer.Service:Wood fence

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.setback: between the front property line and the front yard setback line, fences and solid forms of landscaping shall not exceed 3 feet in height
faq.corner-lot-rules: The visibility triangle of a residential driveway crossing a residential street property line may not be blocked by a fence or solid form of landscaping above a height of three feet (3’). The visibility triangle is made up of the following three lines: 1) a 15 foot line along the back of sidewalk starting where the edge of driveway intersects the sidewalk (Line A-B in Figure 1); 2) a five foot line along the side of the driveway starting at the same point the sidewalk line starts (Line A-C in Figure 1); and 3) a line connecting the two end points of the sidewalk line and the driveway line (Line B-C in Figure 1). Where another street intersects the sidewalk less than 15 feet from the driveway, that point shall be used for the end point of the sidewalk line. Where there is no sidewalk, the edge of pavement shall be used as the appropriate measuring point.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
